headline: Starch-responsive gene with DNA repair and developmental regulation
one_paragraph_summary:
This gene exhibits substrate-specific expression patterns with highest levels on starch-based carbon sources (amylose, amylopectin) reaching 290-430 TPM, suggesting involvement in starch metabolism.
  • Shows marked upregulation in DNA repair mutants (delta mus-52, stc-1) indicating potential roles in DNA damage responses
  • Displays developmental regulation with peak expression at 48 hours during sexual development
  • Responds to iron starvation and shows light-responsive downregulation
  • Expression is positively regulated by transcription factors including XLR-1 for xylan utilization and COL-26 for starch responses
The consistent upregulation across multiple stress conditions (DNA repair defects, nutrient limitations) combined with substrate-specific induction suggests this gene may encode a stress-responsive enzyme involved in carbohydrate metabolism or cellular maintenance pathways.

topics.headline: Strong upregulation on starch substrates with transcriptional control by COL-26
topics.one_sentence_summary: Gene shows preferential expression on complex starch substrates (amylose, amylopectin) that is dependent on the COL-26 transcription factor for proper starch-responsive induction.

topics.headline: Upregulation in DNA repair mutants suggests stress response functions
topics.one_sentence_summary: Gene is consistently upregulated in DNA repair-deficient mutants (delta mus-52, stc-1) indicating potential involvement in compensatory stress responses to genomic instability.

topics.headline: Developmental regulation during sexual reproduction and conidial germination
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression peaks at 48 hours during sexual development and shows highest levels in fresh conidia, suggesting roles in specific developmental transitions.

topics.headline: Carbon source-dependent regulation by multiple transcription factors
topics.one_sentence_summary: Gene responds to various carbon sources with regulation by XLR-1 (xylan), deletion mutants (ADV-1, PP-1), and shows substrate-specific expression patterns across polysaccharides and plant biomass.

topics.headline: Iron starvation response with enhanced sensitivity in ve-1 mutant
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression increases under iron limitation with a more pronounced response in the ve-1 mutant strain, suggesting involvement in metal homeostasis pathways.

topics.headline: SREBP pathway regulation affects expression in sterol biosynthesis context
topics.one_sentence_summary: Gene shows reduced expression in delta sah-2 mutant with partial rescue in double mutants, indicating regulation by SREBP-dependent pathways involved in ergosterol biosynthesis.
